meanings.definition: The act of interlacing or intertwining.
meanings.sent1: The enlacement of the vines created a beautiful pattern on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The enlacement of the threads in the fabric made it strong and durable.
meanings.sent3: The enlacement of the spaghetti on the fork was so tangled, it looked like a messy art piece.
meanings.sent4: The enlacement of the branches in the forest formed a natural canopy overhead.
meanings.sent5: The enlacement of the dancers' arms symbolized unity and harmony in their performance.

meanings.definition: The state of being intertwined or interlaced.
meanings.sent1: The enlacement of the ropes showed how securely the knots were tied.
meanings.sent2: The enlacement of the fingers indicated a strong bond between the couple.
meanings.sent3: The enlacement of the shoelaces made it impossible for him to run without tripping.
meanings.sent4: The enlacement of the roots beneath the ground connected the trees in a hidden network.
meanings.sent5: The enlacement of the puzzle pieces revealed a complete picture when assembled correctly.
